# date

**Instance Property**

The date displayed by the date picker.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var date: Date { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to get and set the currently selected date. The default value of this property is the date when the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker] object is created. Setting this property animates the date picker by spinning the wheels to the new date and time; if you don’t want any animation to occur when you set the date, use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/setDate(_:animated:)] method, passing [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for the `animated` parameter. This behavior of this property is undefined when the mode is set to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/Mode/countDownTimer]; refer instead to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDatePicker/countDownDuration] property.

## Managing the date and calendar

- **calendar**: The calendar to use for the date picker.
- **locale**: The locale used by the date picker.
- **setDate(_:animated:)**: Sets the date to display in the date picker, with an option to animate the setting.
- **timeZone**: The time zone reflected in the date displayed by the date picker.
